quest.name: An Acquired Taste
journal:
The Vath deftarm is looking at the colony's store of muskets, shaking his head.
※The difficulty of this quest will be synced to your current level.

The Vath deftarm is pleased with the progress his guild is making, but with progress comes the need for more tools and weapons. He notes that the muskets that the Nonmind have stolen from the Gnath are falling into disrepair, and he seeks a way to procure more without relying on their enemy. The Vath inquires to you about the goblins, who he heard were quite adept at metalworking. Seeking your help for an introduction to the goblins of Idyllshire, he excitedly sets off to prepare for his new journey. You agree to rendezvous at the border, in the west of Avalonia Fallen.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

Just as you and the deftarm are about to depart for the hinterlands, it soon becomes evident that the Gnath have been following you. With the deftarm rendered immobile by their whispers, the task is left to you to silence them.

When the deftarm comes to his senses, he relays to you that the Gnath had been ordered to obstruct him from leaving the forelands. But he is confused as to why the Overmind gave such a command, given his trivial position among the Vath. Nevertheless, he shakes off his confusion and bids you both continue onward to the hinterlands.

You find an alarmed deftarm standing next to a deceased Illuminati goblin, and the Vath quickly explains he fired out of self-defense. Upon your explanation of how the Illuminati work in contrast to the Idyllshire goblins, he breathes a sigh of relief that he did not murder one of his possible clients. Your journey continues onwards towards Idyllshire.

Slowfix is surprised by the presence of the Vath deftarm in Idyllshire, but seems willing to oblige the request for metalwork. He points you both in the direction of Drydox, who appears to know something of Gnath weaponsmithing.

The deftarm is confused by her request for “jinglyshine,” and admits that he has none. An unimpressed Drydox agrees to create better muskets for the deftarm, but not before he toils to clear the stone rubble scattered throughout the Collectors' Quarter. The deftarm initially declines her request, remarking that such a simple labor is beneath him. But after your stern guidance, he reluctantly accepts and heads off to complete his task.

The request proves no simple task, as the deftarm struggles to clear the immense rubble. Discouraged after his fruitless attempts, he takes a break to enjoy a favorite snack: nanka eggs. Drydox, who came to check on the Vath's progress, immediately notes the eggs' foul stench and grows curious. After a single taste, the goblin takes an immediate liking to the Vathic delicacy. Seeing an opportunity, the deftarm asks Drydox to change the conditions of their arrangement, offering nanka eggs in exchange for metalwork. Drydox excitedly agrees, and a new deal is struck.

The storyteller suspects that something is indeed wrong when, once more, the deftarm fails to return promptly. He reveals to you that all Vath have a lingering connection to the Onemind, and that some retain a stronger connection than others. These Vath must fight harder to reinforce their sense of self against the whispers of the Onemind, for should they forget their purpose, they will lose their individuality and rejoin the colony of Loth ast Gnath. Fearing that the deftarm has fallen victim to their whispers, he asks you to find him and bring him back to his senses before it is too late.
You find a silent deftarm slowly shuffling towards the main colony. With the chat mode in Say, attempt to break his entranced state by calling his name, “Deftarm!” aloud.

The Vath adventurer hears your voice and reaffirms his own identity. While now in control of his mind, it seems he lost his memory after departing from Idyllshire. Confused, he returns towards Loth ast Vath. Speak to him in front of the Adventurers' Guild.

The deftarm tells you he spoke with the storyteller about his strange experience when he gave his report, and the storyteller explained his remaining potent connection to Loth ast Gnath. While the deftarm expresses fear over the thought of losing himself once more, he surmises that his individuality may be preserved should his purpose outweigh the whispers of the Onemind. He vows to do whatever it takes to strengthen his identity as an adventurer.
objectives: Rendezvous with the Vath deftarm in the west of Avalonia Fallen.
Rendezvous with the Vath deftarm near the Arkhitekton.
Search for the Vath deftarm near Loth ast Gnath.
With the chat mode in Say, enter “Deftarm!” to call out to your pupil.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “A Great New Nation.”

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> Well met, Master. Look how the Adventurers' Guild has grown! Our roster is filled with eager Vath, and our clients demand much more of us! Your contribution has been most welcome. Most welcome, indeed.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: Though we no longer suffer from hunger, our safety is not yet guaranteed. The muskets we have stolen from the Gnath have become unreliable. They rust and break easily. What kind of adventurer fights with such poor weapons?

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: Our hive is young. We lack the proper metalworks to forge better muskets. The Vath with such a purpose have been hard at work securing proper resources. But it will take a long time. Too long. In the meantime, we must make do in other ways.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: I thought to ask Jantellot. But he admitted he is not well versed in musket-making. He spoke of the goblins, said they know a great deal about metalworks. But he said they are constant travelers with no true home. It is difficult to discern when they will pass through the forelands.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> Idyllshire? A goblin settlement in the hinterlands? How fortunate that you would know of such a place. Master, surely you could introduce me?

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: What excitement I feel, knowing I can travel on another journey! I am itching at the chance. I will prepare right now. Polish my musket, clean my mandibles... Meet me at the border in the west, guarded by the stone door, beyond the domain of the dragons.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> Jantellot said the goblins are not like man. Could they be likened to dragons, I wonder? With gnashing teeth and─

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: Master, they come!

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: Their voices were toneless. But alluring. They repeated their message. Over and over. “Halt your travels.”

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: Why do they try to interfere? It frustrates me. But I will not let them win. I will keep on, to the hinterlands.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: An adventurer named “Deftarm”? How strange! A gobbie name if Slowfix has ever heard one. Where is he?

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> Master, allow me to explain! He came out of nowhere and attacked, with a knife! I had no choice but to shoot.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: “Illuminati”? He was not from the goblin settlement we seek? Somehow, I am relieved. His savageness reminded me of the Onemind. I was worried all goblins were like him.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: I was taken aback by his face. It was so... <click> <click> No, never mind. Perhaps it is best not to say.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> Do goblins have mouths to speak? Or do they also communicate through the mind?

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Shkohhh... Shkohhh... Behind you, uplander! Massive crawlybug armed with deadly weapon!

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Shkohhh... Not crawlybug, but walkybug? Seeks gobbie metalworkings? Happy to oblige, we are, but Slowfix is not the gobbie with whom uplander should trade tongueflaps. Seek Drydox!

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: Dry...dox? What purpose does one have, with a name like that?

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Reputation of Idyllshire grows large, with walkybugs come to make busydeals with gobbieflock!

dialogue.name: DRYDOX
dialogue.text:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Uplander needs hand-lending? Drydox never tires of giving out busytasks!

dialogue.name: DRYDOX
dialogue.text: Ahhh, a walkybug! It has been many years since Drydox saw your kind.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: I call myself the Vath deftarm. I am an adventurer, just like Master. You have met “walkybugs” like me before?

dialogue.name: DRYDOX
dialogue.text: Before founding free nation in Idyllshire, gobbieflock traveled far and wide. When Drydox was small gobbie, walkybugs wielding boomsticks attacked our tent-ring.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: I see. It must have been the Onemind who attacked you. But I mean you no harm. I have come to befriend the goblins.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> But I did not expect you to be such strange-looking creatures!

dialogue.name: DRYDOX
dialogue.text: Pssshmph! Did Drydox ear-catch walkybug right? Cannot tell skull from sittyparts, and he says gobbies look strange?

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: My apologies. I did not mean to be rude. Slowfix tells me you can make muskets. Very good muskets. Muskets are what I seek. Like this one.

dialogue.name: DRYDOX
dialogue.text: Walkybug wants boomstick like this one? Even baby gobbie with blindyfold can craft better boomstick. For jinglyshine, Drydox will craftybuild best boomstick. Gives wordbond!

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: “Jinglyshine”? I know not what that is. So I do not have any. I came to offer my services in exchange for...boomsticks.

dialogue.name: DRYDOX
dialogue.text: No jinglyshine!? So walkybug wants boomstick as questprize? Hmmm...very well. Collectors' Quarter is filled with debris. If Deftarm wants boomsticks, Deftarm must go and clear away!

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> I decline. Clearing away rocks is no duty for an adventurer. Adventurers fight monsters. Procure items of great worth!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I've had far worse requests than this, you know.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Go and pick up the damn rocks.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> Is adventuring not supposed to be glorious? I thought it was supposed to be glorious.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: But you are right, Master. I am fortunate to have been given a task to perform. Clearing rocks is a worthwhile duty.

dialogue.name: DRYDOX
dialogue.text: Uplander, can Drydox trust you with checkwork? Make certain that walkybug clears Collectors' Quarter with fastness!

dialogue.name: DRYDOX
dialogue.text: Drydox thinks walkybug would be better off returning with jinglyshine for boomsticks. Many, many rocks still litter Collectors' Quarter.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <grunt> If Master has done <pant> simple tasks like these on herhis own, I can do it...<grunt>...too.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> It's no use. It won't budge. And my arms are tired. Perhaps a snack will rejuvenate me.

dialogue.name: DRYDOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Drydox grows impatient and comes to checkwork. Shkohhh... What is this stinkysweet smell? It makes Drydox's belly do whirlyturns!

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <slurp> <slurp> These are <slurp> nanka eggs. Succulent and juicy they are. Would you like one?

dialogue.name: DRYDOX
dialogue.text: Yes, yes! But first, Drydox must remove mask─no sneakypeekers!

dialogue.name: DRYDOX
dialogue.text: <slurp> <slurp> <gulp>

dialogue.name: DRYDOX
dialogue.text: Shkohhh... Tastyfresh, tastyfresh! Like party in mouth with all gobbieflock invited! More stinkeggs, more stinkeggs!

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> Perhaps we can...alter the deal. If you craft boomsticks and metalworks for the Vath, I shall bring you more nanka eggs. Mountains of nanka eggs.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: What a relief that the goblins enjoy the same tastes as we. Let us return to the storyteller right away. Make the final arrangements.

dialogue.name: DRYDOX
dialogue.text:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Gobbies have much respect for sweatworking.

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: <click> <click> The deftarm is not here. Did you not see him on the main road?

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: This bodes ill. He acts strange lately. We worry he may have strayed, to heed the whispers of the Onemind.

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: Be wary of the deftarm, hunter. Our connection to the Overmind has been sundered, but all Vath have a lingering link to the Onemind. Some have a stronger link than others.

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: You must have seen his struggle with the whispers as we have. The Onemind's thoughts against his. It is like a hundred voices humming in unison. He is overwhelmed and cannot act.

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: To be truly freed from the threat of the Onemind, his sense of self must be powerful. Powerful enough to overcome their whispers.

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: If he doubts his purpose, the link may grow stronger. He will forget himself and return to Loth ast Gnath.

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: <click> <click> But we cannot let that happen! He is our brother! He is Vath!

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: <click> <click> The Onemind must be beckoning him towards their hive. He cannot have gone far. Great hunter, you bring him back to his senses!

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: He is young, but his will to become an adventurer is strong. We are certain he will respond to his master's voice. Swiftly now, towards Loth ast Gnath!

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> ... <click> <click>

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter “Deftarm!” to call out to your pupil.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Deftarm!

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> Deft...arm?

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: Yes, that is who I am! The Vath deftarm! I am an adventurer!

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> But what am I doing so far from the colony? I shall hurry back at once.

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: <click> <click> So you were able to reach him. We are relieved.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> I spoke with the storyteller. He explained what is happening to me. About why I lose my way. About why I struggle to fight the Onemind.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: I am sorry for staying silent, Master. I thought I could overcome this on my own. I thought if I declared my purpose, the voices of the Onemind would vanish. Instead, they have grown louder.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> Oh, my mind, it is full of questions! Heavy questions. I fear many things. But I fear losing myself the most.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: I know! Perhaps the Onemind still calls me because my purpose is not strong enough! I must do whatever it takes, to become a capable adventurer. Accept more tasks on my own, reap more rewards! Then the Onemind will whisper no longer.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The goblins of Idyllshire are now clients of the Adventurers' Guild!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have achieved Respected reputation with the Vath.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: New Vath tribal daily quests are now available from the Vath keeneye.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You will receive an experience point bonus upon the completion of the Vath tribal daily quests.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, you will be able to undertake three additional quests from the Vath keeneye as a reputation rank bonus. This bonus is available until the daily reset time for tribal quests.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: These additional quests will become available after accepting all current daily quests from the Vath keeneye. Please be advised that you cannot undertake these quests if you have no remaining allowances.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You now have access to a wider selection of wares from the Vath stickpeddler.
